name: Missing Ranges
title: Missing Ranges
content:
You are given an inclusive range [lower, upper] and a sorted unique integer array nums, where all elements are within the inclusive range.

A number x is considered missing if x is in the range [lower, upper] and x is not in nums.

Return the shortest sorted list of ranges that exactly covers all the missing numbers. That is, no element of nums is included in any of the ranges, and each missing number is covered by one of the ranges.

 

 

Example 1:

Input: nums = [0,1,3,50,75], lower = 0, upper = 99
Output: [[2,2],[4,49],[51,74],[76,99]]
Explanation: The ranges are:
[2,2]
[4,49]
[51,74]
[76,99]

Example 2:

Input: nums = [-1], lower = -1, upper = -1
Output: []
Explanation: There are no missing ranges since there are no missing numbers.

 

Constraints:

  • -109 <= lower <= upper <= 109
  • 0 <= nums.length <= 100
  • lower <= nums[i] <= upper
  • All the values of nums are unique.

discussion_posts.content: Unfortunately, One of the most frustrating experiences was with this question! \n

discussion_posts.content: this problem will shatter the confidence of a lot of young devs

discussion_posts.content: Totally normal problem, I don\'t understand why there\'s so much frustration in the comments.

discussion_posts.name: nikonok
discussion_posts.content: Because of corner cases looks like not "easy" =(

discussion_posts.name: lpaben62
discussion_posts.content: Pay attention to the constraints, especially on the fact that "lower <= nums[i] <= upper". As opposed to number of dislikes may suggest, this problem is actually a good practices for you to pay attention to some of the nuances!

discussion_posts.name: BlackThoughtz
discussion_posts.content: This is a medium because of the disgusting amount of edge cases there are

discussion_posts.name: UtkarshCh
discussion_posts.content: Great question to understand ranges and to understand how to think about edge cases

discussion_posts.name: etanila
discussion_posts.content: LeetCode is not showing the number of dislikes anymore - this problem had (has I guess) 3 times more dislikes than likes. IDK why, but it is what it is.

discussion_posts.name: dlgusgh7979
discussion_posts.content: for nums = [-1], [lower,upper] = [-2,0], why the answer is []?\nshouldn\'t it be [[-2,-2], [0,0]]?
